definition: eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)
flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful
to wind round/to sew with slanting stitches
in confusion or disorder/in a confused state of mind/disorder/upheaval/riot/illicit sexual relations/to throw into disorder/to mix up/indiscriminate/random/arbitrary

sentences.english: He was dazzled by the gaiety and splendour of the metropolis.
sentences.chinese: 大都市的花花世界使他感到眼花缭乱。

sentences.english: In the dazzling image of what is often hidden murderous?
sentences.chinese: 在眼花缭乱的表象之中往往暗藏何种杀机？

sentences.english: I was overwhelmed with all the new things to observe and take into account.
sentences.chinese: 所有新事物都让我眼花缭乱，思绪万千。

sentences.english: As soon as you arrive you will have a bewildering reading list thrust into your hand.
sentences.chinese: 你一到就会有一张让人眼花缭乱的书单塞到你手里。

sentences.english: As I took my seat I was greeted by a dazzling array of silverware at my place setting.
sentences.chinese: 刚一落座，我就被面前摆放的银器弄得眼花缭乱。

sentences.english: Such was the fascinating shadowboxing that went on at nanking .
sentences.chinese: 在南京持续打的就是这样令人眼花缭乱的太极拳。

sentences.english: As soon as he arrived in Handan, he was dazzled to find that everything was novel.
sentences.chinese: 一到邯郸，他感到处处新鲜，简直令人眼花缭乱。

sentences.english: Mulberry dazzled me, I do not know where to start from the pick.
sentences.chinese: 桑果让我眼花缭乱，我都不知道从哪里开始摘了。

sentences.english: Components to permute and combine into a dazzling array of services ?
sentences.chinese: 组件置换，并合并为一个令人眼花缭乱的服务？
篮球时，使姑娘们眼花缭乱。

sentences.english: The number of options is dizzying.
sentences.chinese: 可供选择的方式多得让人眼花缭乱。

sentences.english: The crowd was dazzled by the spectacle.
sentences.chinese: 人群被这一奇观弄得眼花缭乱。

sentences.english: The whole ceiling is decorated dedicatedly, dazzling the people who look at it.
sentences.chinese: 整个天花板精心修饰，令人眼花缭乱。

sentences.english: And reporting from some meetings can be maddening.
sentences.chinese: 而报道另一些会议可能让你眼花缭乱。

sentences.english: Nothing screams "amateur!" louder than a dizzying mishmash of different fonts and colors.
sentences.chinese: 没有什么比眼花缭乱的杂乱颜色和字体更显得业余了。

definition: lit. too much for the eye to take in (idiom); a feast for the eyes
more than one can attend to (idiom)/deluged (with inquiries etc)/overwhelmed (by the beauty of the scenery)
glittering jewels to delight the eye (idiom)/fig. a dazzling lineup
lit. to fill one's eyes with glittering jewels/a literary masterpiece or sb of extraordinary talent (idiom)
bright and multicolored/of rich variety/(fig.) dazzling/glitzy
you can't guard against it (idiom)/impossible to defend effectively/not much one can do about it/It can't be prevented.
lit. as if drunk and stupefied (idiom)/fig. intoxicated by sth/obsessed with/mad about sth
